channel.title: A few scene questions
channel.description:
I'm a bit new to the whole client/server hacking runescape scene, so I've got a few questions :D
Yes, I used the search feature ;p, however, most of my research had me wade through tons of uninformative posts, with the occasional gold mine here and there. I still have a few unanswered questions though :( :
1) Are game elements like npcs, weapons, and the like are (from what I understand) all client side? 2) If I have a server built off of base X, do I need a matching client? Or can I use any custom client? 3) I've seen a couple sources for both client and server lying around. What is recommended for a starter? :p
As an addenum, I know how to program in java, it's just a matter of where to begin :)
Thanks for any and all help.

item.dc:creator: @legendaryskittle legendaryskittle
item.description:
@legendaryskittle wrote:

I realize that. It was just an expression. I was just trying to be nice…

Read full topic

item.title: A few scene questions
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

legendaryskittle:

1) Are game elements like npcs, weapons, and the like are (from what I understand) all client side?

Yes, but some configurations such as price and bonuses are controlled via the server

legendaryskittle:

2) If I have a server built off of base X, do I need a matching client? Or can I use any custom client?

As long as it uses the same cache version it should be ok. Look out for numbers 317,474,503,508,525 etc

legendaryskittle:

3) I’ve seen a couple sources for both client and server lying around. What is recommended for a starter?

If you know Java well use rs2dv: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,227037.0.html

Read full topic
